config team meeting minutes


august 18 (wed.), 2005

attendance:
ht (hyung-tae)
yn (yunni)
nr (nariy)
dw (dong-wook)
jk (jong-ku)
kh (kihup)

agenda:

  • To present and review assigned classes

  • API Milestones


UTIL & Log

kb:
i will summarize the article contents on the coska web site.
I am going to present Util and Log classes.
I reassigned the Values class to nr.
we need to set up a test team, one person from each group
we will start doing some preparation for unit test

UserList & User

jk: i updated my classes.
Do we need to have two classes?
- UserList
has main functions
has hashtable for storing user id and passwords
modifed add(...) method
- User
has 2 constructors
has user id and password accessors
two methods were renamed: encryption and decryption

ht: UserList is for server management
ht: assymetric needs public key, symetric does not need one.
asymetric is a safer way of doing authentication.

kb: let's ponder this later (which approach to choose) since this is not API.

FileFilter

dw: FileFilter
FileFilter maintains several info items - e.g. include/exclude list of files or folders
File I/O team is the target consumer of this API

kh: why is file size relevant?

dw: file size will be used to determine the back up precedence

Values

nr: Values has 3 major funcitons
1. contains several necessary public constants, some of these may be used in load and/or save. e.g. synchronization options
2. load
3. save

nr: why do we need IsUndefinedTime() method?

ht: sometimes there would be a case for comparing two times. if we provide 'undefined time', we can tell whether or not any time variable has been explicitly set.

Schedule & ScheduleList

yn: this is the same pattern as User & UserList
one of the functions gives users an option of backup repeating interval, is this correct?

ht: yep

yn: i modified a few methods too.

kh: isn't Schedule supposed to be done by File IO team?
nr: i think the scheduling parameters are stored by Values.
ht: IO team does the scheduling. Schedule keeps the values that are specific to backup plan.
kb: let's ponder single vs. multiple storages for keeping configuration parameter values

Config

ht: Config is a place holder for the other modules.
I created TempConfig for the other team to use temporarily as needs arise (this is used for the parameters that are to be known as development progresses). Later the values in the class will be abstracted out and moved to the other actual classes. This class will be removed before product release.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
ht: kh needs a Hangul keyboard, which might cost only about $20.00
kh: ok. i would buy one. bring a keyboard next time

kh: we need to research on projector models so that we can buy one soon. ht & jk will suggest a few models for consideration.

nr (she contributed $20.00 for the projector purchase. many thanks!).

ht: we need to know nr's phone number. we could not contact her last time.
nr: 416-xxx-xxxx

kh: OK, this would be end of the meeting.
kh: let's spend a week or so to come up with our initial API. focus on the public ones only and disregard implemention aspects for now. The API candidate will be reviewed by the other teams to get feedback for improvements. also research background technologies - e.g. XML serialization/deserialization, encryption/decryption, and etc...
